image.altText: A smiling man sitting on the rung of a helicopter in grassland, wearing a trucker cap and bright blue ag worker shirt.

props.synopsis: In its report, the ATSB found the helicopter likely crashed because of fuel exhaustion resulting in engine stoppage.

title.children: ATSB releases final report into chopper crash that killed Netflix star Chris 'Willow' Wilson

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu speaks during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet approves a deal for a four-day ceasefire on Gaza in exchange for the release of 50 Hamas-held hostages. Follow live.

title.children: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire in exchange for release of some hostages

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire in exchange for release of some hostages

Senior doctor in Al-Shifa hospital says dialysis patients will die

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson.

props.synopsis: Before settling, Bruce Lehrmann was due to take on the ABC in the Federal Court in Sydney today. The former Liberal staffer's defamation action against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson continues.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action against Lisa Wilkinson, Network Ten begins after ABC settlement

image.altText: A composite image of James Rose and Stephen Gale.

props.synopsis: Police discover what they believe are the remains of a pilot and camera operator missing after a plane crash in Port Phillip bay on Sunday.

title.children: Human remains found after Port Phillip plane crash believed to be pilot, camera operator

image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a mobile phone, which is displaying an apology to customers written on the Optus website.

props.synopsis: Submissions to a Senate inquiry outline what happened behind the scenes as Optus rushed to fix its recent outage.

title.children: Urgent meetings, router resets and 400 workers: Behind the scenes of the Optus outage

image.altText: A car parked outside a home, with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged over the alleged murder of a woman in suburban Adelaide — one of four female victims who have died in suspicious circumstances in domestic settings in the past week.

title.children: Another murder charge laid after four women killed in SA in past week

image.altText: A hand holding a credit card out towards a recipient.

props.synopsis: The Australian Bureau of Statistics survey finds around 16 per cent of women have experienced some form of economic abuse. A leading women's advocate says it's a form of abuse that too often is flying under the radar.

title.children: Economic abuse affects about 16 per cent of Australian women. For some, it takes years to recover

image.altText: A composite image of a father and son, and a couple and their daughter

props.synopsis: The families of five people killed in a crash outside a regional Victorian pub are told it could take a long time for any case to be finalised.

title.children: Police yet to decide whether to charge driver in fatal Daylesford pub crash, court told

image.altText: Faisal holds a banner calling for help while his wife and children stand with him

props.synopsis: Men who spent years in detention on Manus Island living in the hope of resettlement now face being evicted from their temporary homes.

title.children: These refugees were detained for years on Manus Island. Now they're caught between three countries

image.altText: High school students sitting in a classroom using laptops

props.synopsis: At the start of 2023, experts warned ChatGPT would swamp schools in a wave of cheating. With the academic year wrapping up, we asked students what really happened.

title.children: ChatGPT was tipped to cause widespread cheating. Here's what students say happened

image.altText: Pat Riley stands in front of red dirt cliffs in the Kimberley and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: In 2021, Telstra faced court for its treatment of First Nations customers. New figures obtained by the ABC show the scale of the problem is much worse than first thought.

title.children: This mother feared she would end up in jail over huge phone bills, a problem experts say is greater than first thought

image.altText: A soccer player wearing blue and yellow takes a photo with her girlfriend after a match

props.synopsis: After months of speculation, Matildas star Sam Kerr shares photos from the moment she proposed to her long-term girlfriend, American professional soccer player Kristie Mewis.

title.children: Matildas star Sam Kerr shares glimpse of the moment she proposed to partner Kristie Mewis

image.altText: Clare O’Neil at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The government says it was considering releasing a child rapist from detention to avoid a legal challenge that would see the release of other indefinitely detained criminals.

title.children: Government considered releasing child rapist to avoid High Court immigration ruling

image.altText: A Mac laptop resting on a bed in the dark

props.synopsis: The proposed changes come after child safety advocates accused the federal government of not doing enough to keep kids safe online.

title.children: Online companies will be forced to do more to stop AI deepfake child abuse content

image.altText: Close-up of tail of a Virgin Australia aircraft at Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: While NT residents face return airfares of up to $2,000 to fly interstate, the NT government has faced criticism for announcing cheap flights from the East Coast to Uluru from mid-next year.

title.children: NT government defends Uluru flights deal amid expensive Christmas airfares

image.altText: A composite image of a young man, an older man and a woman

props.synopsis: The Netanyahu family has towered over Israeli politics for more than two decades. Now, the prime minister's popularity is plummeting and some people are questioning if his relatives are pulling the strings.

title.children: The angry nanny, the flying bed, and the powerful family hanging by a thread

image.altText: A man in a white hospital mask and dark brown eyes looks into the camera under a spotlight

props.synopsis: Genes, environment and lifestyle are some of the risk factors for serious diseases like Parkinson's and Alzheimer's. This is why scientists believe COVID-19 infection should be added to the list, writes Catherine Taylor.

title.children: 'We are the sum of our histories': A COVID infection now could spell trouble in three decades

image.altText: In an opulent room with ornate chairs, grand piano and golden candelabras, smiling man in black suit leans against piano.

props.synopsis: Mitch has always been open to new ideas. So when someone suggested sex work, the early-career lawyer decided to try it as a 'side hustle'. It turned into something more.

title.children: How a lawyer's sex work side hustle turned into something much more

image.altText: A middle aged man wearing a white t-shirt and beige jacket

props.synopsis: Councillors from outside Sydney are accused of making discriminatory comments during a state conference debate about a support network for LGBTQIA+ representatives and drag story time events.

title.children: Sydney councillor vows to push ahead with LGBTIQA+ network after 'homophobic' NSW conference debate

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market opens fairly flat, as gains across the mining sector, particularly in gold, offset falls elsewhere. Follow the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters on our live blog.

title.children: ASX fairly flat as miners offset falls in other sectors, Healius plunges on share sale

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX fairly flat as more sectors gain
Will the federal government miss its own fuel efficiency target?

image.altText: Screenshots from three TikToks showing various watermelon games.

props.synopsis: TikTok creators say using this filter will raise money for charity. It's the latest example of digital activism sweeping social media platforms, but it sounds a little too good to be true — so, is it?

title.children: TikTok filters are the latest weapon in online activism — but do they work?

image.altText: Two dirty hands hold a gold ring with a tear shaped white diamond.

props.synopsis: Diamond prices have fallen significantly since the start of last year, but even with higher interest rates and competition from lab grown stones, industry insiders say they don't expect the recent price declines to last forever.

title.children: If diamonds are a girl's best friend, why are their prices in freefall?

image.altText: The Hutchins School logo, a lion, on a school building with out-of-focus leaves in the foreground

props.synopsis: Peter was in prison when he happened to catch an episode of Australian Story about Grace Tame. When he saw her abuser — Nicolaas Bester — pop up on the screen, he says he "froze".

title.children: 'I saw Grace Tame and then I saw a picture of him': TV episode prompts new abuse claim against Nicolaas Bester

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: Australian financial markets are now pointing to a close to zero chance of further rate rises — with a fair chance of a rate cut next year. That's thanks to the latest news from the US and UK, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: What has just happened in the US will help Australia's inflation situation, big time

image.altText: Teenage boy smiling at camera

props.synopsis: At the age of 16, Knox Gibson from Central West New South Wales achieves Hollywood success with a role in The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes.

title.children: Australian teen snags big role in Hunger Games prequel after losing part of arm in painful childhood accident

image.altText: Two police officers hold a woman by the arms at a pro-Palestinian rally

props.synopsis: About 400 pro-Palestinian activists last night gathered at the port to protest against the unloading of an Israeli-owned shipping company vessel.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists charged over protest against Israeli shipping line at Sydney's Port Botany

image.altText: A line of shoppers with trolleys stretches down a supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: The prolonged cost-of-living crisis is continuing into a what is traditionally a period of financial stress, creating fears in the retail sector of increased abuse of workers over Christmas.

title.children: Christine put a hand on a customer's trolley to investigate suspected shoplifting. Then she was punched in the face

image.altText: Three men standing on a street

props.synopsis: There was a time when seemingly nothing could touch Top Gear, but presenter Andrew Flintoff's massive crash proves things have changed since the BBC behemoth's early days, writes Riley Stuart.

title.children: Top Gear was a global phenomenon, but not even it could survive this scandal

image.altText: Pat Cummins smiles holding the World Cup trophy

props.synopsis: By winning the Cricket World Cup, the World Test Championship and retaining the Ashes away from home, Pat Cummins says this Australian cricket team have established an era-defining legacy.

title.children: 'We pretty much had to be flawless': Cummins hails era-defining legacy of Australia's cricket team

image.altText: A woman looking at the camera intensely

props.synopsis: A Melbourne woman recovering from surgery said the airline told her she could not fly because she could not climb the stairs, despite her organising for assistance in advance.

title.children: Melbourne woman recovering from surgery 'humiliated' by Jetstar refusal to let her board flight

image.altText: Israeli tanks operate in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Israel's government has voted to back a deal to secure the release of some of the hostages held in Gaza over four days where there will be a "pause in fighting".

title.children: Israel-Gaza ceasefire deal reached to release hostages over four days

image.altText: Danielle McGahey poses in Canada kit

props.synopsis: Australia-born cricketer Danielle McGahey says her international career with Canada is over "as quickly as it begun" as the ICC banned players who have gone through male puberty from international women's cricket.

title.children: 'I will not stop fighting for equality': Transgender cricketer's stand after ICC ban

image.altText: a close up of a snake with a spotty tail on the sand

props.synopsis: The yellow-bellied sea snake, which usually lives off the continental shelf, intrigues locals but comes with a warning from wildlife rescuers.

title.children: Highly venomous sea snake found far from home on NSW south coast beach

image.altText: Nick Watson, Colby McKercher, Harley Reid, Jed Walter and Zane Duursma pose for a photo

props.synopsis: The AFL draft has been completed, with all 18 clubs adding to their lists with players they hope will be stars of the future. Here's who your club selected and what it means for your team.

title.children: How did your club fare at the AFL draft? Every team's haul analysed
